issue.title: Add packages to provisioning of constellation
Add packages to provisioning of constellation

content.raw:
The following is a list of packages that we install with our install script:

```ros-fuerte-arm-navigation
              ros-fuerte-desktop-full
              ros-fuerte-documentation
              ros-fuerte-laser-drivers
              ros-fuerte-multimaster-experimental
              ros-fuerte-pr2-arm-navigation
              ros-fuerte-pr2-controllers
              ros-fuerte-pr2-simulator
              ros-fuerte-pr2-navigation-apps
              ros-fuerte-linux-networking
              ros-fuerte-console-bridge
              ros-fuerte-urdfdom
              ros-fuerte-urdfdom-headers
              ros-fuerte-navigation-experimental
              drcsim
git 
                  subversion 
                  mercurial
                  python-pip
                  libgtkglext1-dev 
                  libdc1394-22-dev 
                  python-cvxopt 
                  python-scipy
                  libgles1-mesa 
                  libgles2-mesa 
                  libopenal1 
                  libopencv-highgui2.4 
                  python-pmw
                  libosmesa6 
                  libxxf86dga-dev
                  build-essential 
                  libtinyxml-dev 
                  libtbb-dev 
                  libxml2-dev 
                  libqt4-dev 
                  pkg-config  
                  libprotoc-dev 
                  libfreeimage-dev 
                  libprotobuf-dev 
                  protobuf-compiler 
                  libboost-all-dev 
                  freeglut3-dev 
                  cmake 
                  libogre-dev 
                  libtar-dev 
                  libcurl4-openssl-dev
                  liblapack-dev
                  meshlab
                  libegl1-mesa 
                  libegl1-mesa-drivers 
                  libgbm1 
                  libopenvg1-mesa 
                  libwayland0
                  libxcb-xfixes0
                  libenet-dev
                  libglpk-dev ```

We actually won't need all of those for the field computer machines but it wouldn't hurt to have them on there. If necessary I can attempt to trim it down if you would prefer  to have a more minimal install.
content.html:
The following is a list of packages that we install with our install script:

ros-fuerte-arm-navigation ros-fuerte-desktop-full ros-fuerte-documentation ros-fuerte-laser-drivers ros-fuerte-multimaster-experimental ros-fuerte-pr2-arm-navigation ros-fuerte-pr2-controllers ros-fuerte-pr2-simulator ros-fuerte-pr2-navigation-apps ros-fuerte-linux-networking ros-fuerte-console-bridge ros-fuerte-urdfdom ros-fuerte-urdfdom-headers ros-fuerte-navigation-experimental drcsim git subversion mercurial python-pip libgtkglext1-dev libdc1394-22-dev python-cvxopt python-scipy libgles1-mesa libgles2-mesa libopenal1 libopencv-highgui2.4 python-pmw libosmesa6 libxxf86dga-dev build-essential libtinyxml-dev libtbb-dev libxml2-dev libqt4-dev pkg-config libprotoc-dev libfreeimage-dev libprotobuf-dev protobuf-compiler libboost-all-dev freeglut3-dev cmake libogre-dev libtar-dev libcurl4-openssl-dev liblapack-dev meshlab libegl1-mesa libegl1-mesa-drivers libgbm1 libopenvg1-mesa libwayland0 libxcb-xfixes0 libenet-dev libglpk-dev

We actually won't need all of those for the field computer machines but it wouldn't hurt to have them on there. If necessary I can attempt to trim it down if you would prefer to have a more minimal install.

content.html: After using the cloudsim a bit I would also like to request screen

issue.title: Add packages to provisioning of constellation

content.raw:
drcsim should be loaded on the field computers, so we have atlas_msgs, osrf_msgs, etc.

Currently I can manually download gazebo 1.8.6 but it refuses to install drcsim:

sudo apt-get install drcsim
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
Some packages could not be installed. This may mean that you have
requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable
distribution that some required packages have not yet been created
or been moved out of Incoming.
The following information may help to resolve the situation:

The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 drcsim : Depends: gazebo (>= 1.8.4) but it is not going to be installed
          Depends: gazebo (< 1.9.0) but it is not going to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.

********************

Hmmm, the simulator computer doesn't have drcsim either. Something in cloudsim/softlayer is totally broken.

******************************

Attempt to install drcsim from source fails:


[rosbuild] Building package atlas_msgs
Failed to invoke /opt/ros/fuerte/bin/rospack deps-manifests atlas_msgs
[rospack] Error: package/stack atlas_msgs depends on non-existent package pr2_controller_manager


CMake Error at /opt/ros/fuerte/share/ros/core/rosbuild/public.cmake:129 (message):
  

  Failed to invoke rospack to get compile flags for package 'atlas_msgs'.
  Look above for errors from rospack itself.  Aborting.  Please fix the
  broken dependency!

Call Stack (most recent call first):
  /opt/ros/fuerte/share/ros/core/rosbuild/public.cmake:203 (rosbuild_invoke_rospack)
  CMakeLists.txt:17 (rosbuild_init)


-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
make[2]: *** [ros/atlas_msgs-prefix/src/atlas_msgs-stamp/atlas_msgs-configure] Error 1
make[1]: *** [ros/CMakeFiles/atlas_msgs.dir/all] Error 2
make: *** [all] Error 2

********************************************

Downloaded all the packages mentioned in the drcsim installation instructions.
Now happily compiling drcsim from source on fc1 and sim.

*******************

Things are too broken to fix.
content.html:
drcsim should be loaded on the field computers, so we have atlas_msgs, osrf_msgs, etc.

Currently I can manually download gazebo 1.8.6 but it refuses to install drcsim:

sudo apt-get install drcsim Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree
Reading state information... Done Some packages could not be installed. This may mean that you have requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable distribution that some required packages have not yet been created or been moved out of Incoming. The following information may help to resolve the situation:

The following packages have unmet dependencies: drcsim : Depends: gazebo (>= 1.8.4) but it is not going to be installed Depends: gazebo (< 1.9.0) but it is not going to be installed E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.

Hmmm, the simulator computer doesn't have drcsim either. Something in cloudsim/softlayer is totally broken.

Attempt to install drcsim from source fails:

[rosbuild] Building package atlas_msgs Failed to invoke /opt/ros/fuerte/bin/rospack deps-manifests atlas_msgs [rospack] Error: package/stack atlas_msgs depends on non-existent package pr2_controller_manager

CMake Error at /opt/ros/fuerte/share/ros/core/rosbuild/public.cmake:129 (message):

Failed to invoke rospack to get compile flags for package 'atlas_msgs'. Look above for errors from rospack itself. Aborting. Please fix the broken dependency!

Call Stack (most recent call first): /opt/ros/fuerte/share/ros/core/rosbuild/public.cmake:203 (rosbuild_invoke_rospack) CMakeLists.txt:17 (rosbuild_init)

-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred! make[2]: [ros/atlas_msgs-prefix/src/atlas_msgs-stamp/atlas_msgs-configure] Error 1 make[1]: [ros/CMakeFiles/atlas_msgs.dir/all] Error 2 make: *** [all] Error 2

Downloaded all the packages mentioned in the drcsim installation instructions. Now happily compiling drcsim from source on fc1 and sim.

Things are too broken to fix.

issue.title: Add packages to provisioning of constellation

content.raw: Superseded by issue #127.  We're not going to touch the fc1/fc2 machines between practice and competition, leaving it up to teams to install whatever they like.
content.html: Superseded by issue #127. We're not going to touch the fc1/fc2 machines between practice and competition, leaving it up to teams to install whatever they like.

issue.title: Add packages to provisioning of constellation

content.raw: @catkeson , you probably updated at an unlucky time, while the new drcsim binary package was still building.  If you were to try again now, the `apt-get` install should work fine.
content.html: @catkeson , you probably updated at an unlucky time, while the new drcsim binary package was still building. If you were to try again now, the apt-get install should work fine.
